Name: Packet Counter Service
Problem: Counting carrier packets on the Dolv3 web client created excessive database load, leading to slow page load time and reduced database performance
Solution: Creation of microservice to perform packet counting in memory and store the count in the database
Implementation: The service continually reads the packet message queue into hash table.
The service periodically counts packets and writes the total count per carrier to database
The service flushes out packets that are too old to be relevant in counts
Practices: Utilized several design patterns, including factories, interfaces, templates, and dependency injection
SOLID design principles to promote code reuse and reduce repetition
Equipped with extensive logging and unit tests
Result: Packet count webpage load time decreased from 30 seconds to under one second
Eliminated over 2 million database operations per page instance per minute, significantly reducing database strain leading to system-wide performance increases
Improved code quality by moving business logic out of the user interface and database
